meanings.sent1: The bird had a whistleable tune that echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The referee's whistleable call signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent3: The whistleable wind made the trees dance in harmony.
meanings.sent4: The whistleable melody of the flute enchanted all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The whistleable sound of the kettle boiling filled the kitchen with a cheerful note.

meanings.sent1: The smooth surface of the glass was whistleable, allowing for a clear tone.
meanings.sent2: The metal whistleable material of the instrument produced a sharp sound.
meanings.sent3: The whistleable straw made it easy for the child to mimic bird calls.
meanings.sent4: The whistleable design of the teapot made it a favorite among tea lovers.
meanings.sent5: The whistleable lid of the pot let out a high-pitched sound when lifted.
